description: Erection of rear lower ground floor extension and side infill to ground and first floor with minor interior alterations and opening of coal vaults. Openings to be cut into the lower ground floor rear wall and lower ground floor level to be reinstated at original level. Staircase renovated or replaced where necessary with alterations to the wall of the first floor bathroom to increase headroom.
decision_conditions:
The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.

The Development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this consent.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of Section 18(a) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 as amended.

<p dir="ltr" style="margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; line-height: 1.38;">Prior to the commencement of works on the development, the following details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp;</p><p dir="ltr" style="margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; line-height: 1.38;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">a) Details of results of the foundation trial pit survey including the depth, design and extent of the historic foundations&nbsp;</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; line-height: 1.38;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">b) A method statement outlining the works necessary to lower the ground floor level, including an assessment of the impact of lowering the floor on the historic foundations&nbsp;</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; line-height: 1.38;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">c) Drawings showing the extent of floor lowering and proposed floor build-up</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; line-height: 1.38;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; vertical-align: baseline;"><br></span></p><p dir="ltr" style="margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; line-height: 1.38;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">REASON: To safeguard the significance of the listed building.</span></p>

<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;">Before the start of the relevant part of the works, a Window Report and Method Statement shall be provided by a historic windows specialist and submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp; The Report shall detail the age and condition of the windows and the Method Statement shall detail any repair works proposed to be undertaken to the windows. Any replacement fabric shall accurately replicate the windows elsewhere in the building in terms of material, profile and detailing. The works shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the approved Method Statement.</p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><br></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;">REASON:&nbsp;To safeguard the significance of the listed building.</p>

<p>Before the start of the relevant part of the works, a condition report on the staircase shall be provided by a competent joiner. This should include details of any repair works proposed to be undertaken including drawings of details such as replacement treads.</p><p>REASON: To safeguard the significance of the listed building.</p>
